name: 林鈞陶
objective: This course provides the fundamental theories and architectures for baseband wireless communications. It is concerned that how reliable communication can be achieved and what is the capacity a channel can provide. Much attention will be focused on the newly developed technology, referred to as multiple-input multiple-output (MIMO) transmission.
schedule:
Part I: Basic Concepts:
Week 1: Introduction.
Week 2: Overview of Linear Algebra.
Week 3: Single-Input Single-Output (SISO). 
Part II: Multiple-Input Multiple-Output (MIMO).
Week 4: Spatial Multiplexing and Receiver Design.
Week 5: No Class (National Holidays).
Week 6: Spatial Multiplexing and Receiver Design.
Week 7: Space-Time Coding
Week 8: Space-Time Coding
Week 9: Midterm.
Week 10: MIMO Precoding. 
Week 11: MIMO Precoding. 
Part III: Multi-User (MU) and Massive MIMO.
Week 12: MU-MIMO Communications.
Week 13: MU-MIMO Communications.
Week 14: Massive MIMO.
Week 15: Massive MIMO.
Week 16-18: Final Projects.
scorePolicy:
Quizzes 30%
Midterm 30%
Final Projects 40% (can be in Chinese or English)
materials:
1. Fundamentals of Wireless Communication (by David Tse)
2. Foundations of MIMO communication (by Robert W. Heath Jr.)
